Institution: SJRSC - ST. JOHNS RIVER STATE COLLEGE
Prerequisites: ACG 2021C WITH A GRADE OF “C” OR BETTER.
Course Description: THIS COURSE IS DESIGNED TO GIVE STUDENTS EXPERIENCE USING A COMPUTERIZED ACCOUNTING SYSTEM TO ENHANCE KNOWLEDGE GAINED IN EARLIER ACCOUNTING COURSES AND PREPARE THEM FOR THE JOB MARKET. STUDENTS WILL GAIN PRACTICAL KNOWLEDGE IN GENERATING INVOICES, CASH DISBURSEMENTS, CASH RECEIPTS, INVENTORY CONTROL, ACCOUNTS PAYABLE JOURNALS, CUSTOMER LEDGERS, VENDOR LEDGERS, JOB ORDER COSTING, FIXED ASSET DEPRECIATION, COMPANY SET-UPS, AND INTERNET ACCOUNTING SERVICES.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THE COURSE STUDENTS WILL BE ABLE TO:
1. IDENTIFY THE FUNCTIONS OF COMPUTER ACCOUNTING SOFTWARE.
2. COMPILE BUSINESS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS USING ACCOUNTING SOFTWARE TO GENERATE ALL RECORDED BUSINESS TRANSACTIONS INCLUDING: SALES INVOICES, ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE, PURCHASE ORDERS, AND ACCOUNTS PAYABLE, AND PAYROLL.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
